__data__.text:
www. lawcommission.gov.np  
1 
 The Council o f Animal Health and Livestock Service Professional s Act, 2079  
      Date of Assent  and Publication   
         2079 -06-23 
Act No. 29 of the year 2079  
An Act Made to Provide for the Management of the Council o f the Animal Health 
and Livestock Service Professional s 
Preamble  : Whereas, it is expedient  to establish a Council of Animal Health and 
Livestock Service Professionals to develop a  good  animal health and livestock 
service profession by marshalling orderly , high quality and dignified animal he alth 
and livestock  service  professions , except for registered veterinarians and  can be 
registered with the Nepal Veterinary Council in accordance with the prevailing law  
of Nep al; 
 Be it enacted by the Federal Parliament .  
Chapter - 1  
Preliminary   
1. Short t itle and commencement:  (1) This Act may be cited  as the “ Council o f 
Animal Health and Livestock  Service  Professional s Act, 2079 (2022).”  
 (2) The Act shall come into force from the 3 1st day of the date of 
assent.  
2. Definition : Unless the subject or the cont ext otherwise requires, in this Act:

www. lawcommission.gov.np  
3 
  
Chap ter -2  
Establishment, Constitution , Functions, Duties and Powers of the Council  
3. Establishment of Council:  (1) There shall be established a  Council of the 
Animal Health and Livestock Service Professionlas to register names of 
animal heath and livestock service professionals in accordance with the 
provincial law in order to make animal health and livestock service 
profession  orderly, high quality and dignified , except for registered 
veterinarians and  can be registered with the Nepal Veterinary Council .  
  (2) The office of the Council shall be located in Kathmandu Valley.   
4. Council to be an autonomous body corporate:  (1) The Council shall be an 
autonomous body corporate with perpetual succession and legal personality.   
(2) As a legal entity, t he Council shall  exercise  rights, fulfill duties, 
and bear the  responsibilities.   
5. Formation of the Council : (1) The Council shall consist of the following 
members: - 
(a) One person appointed by the  Government 
of Nepal  from among st the persons 
registered as at least a Class “B” animal 
health and livestock  service  professionals 
with five years of experience.  - Chairperson

www. lawcommission.gov.np  
4 
 (b) One person  elected from amongst the 
persons registered as at least a Class “B” 
animal health and livestock service 
professionals .  - Vice -chairperson  
(c) Two persons  includi ng at leas t one femal e 
amongst from animal health and livestock 
service professionals nominated by the 
ministry.  - Member  
(d) Seven  person elected from each province  
amongst from animal health and livestock  
service   professionals .  - Member  
(e) Four persons including at lea st two 
females elected from amongst animal 
health and livestock service professional s.  - Member  
(f) Two professionals including at l east one 
female nominated by the C ouncil from 
amongst the animal health and livestock 
service professionals  engaged in  the 
teaching of animal health and livestock  
service  at universit ies or educational 
institution s and the Council for Technical 
Education and Vocational Training . - Member

www. lawcommission.gov.np  
5 
 (g) One official as a representative from the 
Nepal Veteri nary Council.   -  Member  
(h) Regist rar  - Member -secretary  
(2) The e lection of members specified  in clause s (b), (d), and (e) 
of sub-section (1) shall be as prescribed.   
(3) The term of office of members nominated and elected , as the case 
may be,  in accordan ce with sub-section ( 1) shall be  for a perio d of four 
years. Members whose terms have expired may be appointed or re -elected 
for another term.  
(4) Notwithstanding anything contained  in sub -section (3) , if any 
member acts contrary to the functions, duties a nd powers of the Council, the 
Government of Nepal may remove such a member from office at any time.  
 Provided that such a member shall be provided an opportunity 
to be heard before being  remov ed from the office.   
(5)  If a seat  of any member becomes  vacan t prior t o the end of the 
term of office, the Council may cause to  nominate or electe , as the case may 
be, another member  for such a remaining period.   
 Provided that, if the remaining term is less than one year, 
nomination or election , as the case may be , shall not made for such a  vacant 
position .

www. lawcommission.gov.np  
6 
 (6) The Government of Nepal may form a committee  representing the 
sectors as  specified  in sub -section (1) to carry out the functions of the 
Council until it is constituted  pursuant to sub -section (1) .  
(7) Whil e constitution  of the committee pursuant to sub -section (6), it 
shall be done so having represent ation of  such per sons with qualifications of 
the animal health and livestock  service  professional s specified in section 17.   
(8) The tenure o f the committee pu rsuant to sub -section (6) shall be a 
maximum  of one yea r.  
(9) The nominated or  elected member , as the case may be,  pursuant to 
sub-section (1) shall be done based on the principle of inclusivity.   
(10) When Council ’s members are elected or nominated ,  as the case 
may be,  in accordance with  sub-section  (1), the representation shall  take 
place alternately to ensure equal representation of all sectors  related to 
animal health and livestock  service .  
6. Deemed to be d isqualified:   No one  shall  be eligible to be nominated or 
elected , as the case may be,  as a member of the Council  on the following 
condition :- 
(a) Who is not a citizen of Nepal;   
(b) Whose name has been removed from the register;   
(c) Who has been convicte d by the  court of corruption, rape, human 
trafficking and  transportation, drugs trafficking and transportation , 
money laundering, passport fraud, a bduction related offence or 
criminal offence  involving moral turpitude ;

www. lawcommission.gov.np  
7 
 (d) Who has been blacklisted pursuant to the  prevailing law  of Nepal;   
(e) Who is incapable of  servi ng in the Council due to the physical and 
mental illness,   
(f) Who has become insolvent pursuant to the prevailing law  of Nepal.  
7. Cessation of membership : (1) The membership of the Council shall cease to 
exist on the following circumstances: - 
(a) If any member becomes  disqualified to become a member under 
Section 6 ;  
(b) If any member tenders resignation  in writing ; 
(c) If any member  becomes absent of three consecutive meeetings 
without giving a prior notice with good reasons  to the Council thereof;  
(d) If any member is dead .  
(2) When submitting  a resignation under clause (b) of sub–section (1), 
the Chairperson shall send it in writing to the Government of Nepal through 
the Ministry and the other member  shall  send it in writing  to the 
Chairperson.  
8. Functions, Duties and Powers  of the Council : The functions, duties and 
powers of the Council shall be as follows , namely: -  
(a) To formulate policies, plans and programs that may be necessary to 
make the animal health and livestock  service profession  well 
managed, standardized, respected  and effective and submit them to 
the Ministry for approval;

www. lawcommission.gov.np  
8 
 (b) To implement,  or cause to  be implement ed, the approved poli cies, 
pans and programs by the G overnment of Nepal to run the animal 
health and livestock  service  profession  regularly;  
(c) To lay down  a national standard o n animal health and livestock  
service  professional s and implement having  it approved by the 
Ministry;  
(d) To advice  the M inistry  on improving  the production of animal and 
livestock  related products , the manufacturing, processing and 
marketi ng of the products related to animal breeding s, and also 
improving the quality of animal husbandry system ;  
(e) To determine  qualification s for the  animal health and livestock service 
professionals ; 
(f) To coordinate with the P rovincial Government s and the Local Levels 
in relation  with animal health and livestock  service professional s;   
(g) To collect record s related to animal health and livestock  service  
profession from the entities as may be prescribed by the provinve law, 
and update  thereof;  
(h) To prepare a national level code of conduct  for the  animal health  and 
livestock service professional s and have it implemented ;  
(i) To provide necessary suggestions  to the Ministry on matters  related to 
animal health and livestock service,   
(j) To exchange research or knowledge conduct ed or obtained according 
to international standards with other countries in the field of animal

www. lawcommission.gov.np  
9 
 health and make proposals to the Government of Nepa l on matters 
which deem appropriate to Nepal;  
(k) To inspect, supervise and monitor  on whether  or not  the code o f 
conduct determined by the Council is being observed, and remove  the 
name of animal health and livestock  service  professional from a 
register book maintained at the Council who fails to observe the code 
of conduct  prescribed by the Council and request in writing to remove 
the name from a register  book if it is registered at the provincial 
office;   
(l) To perform such other functions as may be necessary  for the 
attainment of the objectives of the Council.   
9. Meeting of the Council:  (1) The meeting of the Council  shall be held at the 
date, time and place as may be prescribed  by the chairperson.   
(2) The Council shall , in general,  hold its meeting four times a year .  
(3) The meetings of the C ouncil  shall be chaired by the Chairperson  
and, in his absence, the Vice Chairperson , and in the absence of both, the 
senior member attending the meeting.  
(4) It shall be deemed to constitute a quorum for a meeting of the 
Council  if more than fifty percent of the total number s of the Council are 
present  at the meeting.  
(5) In the Council meeting, the decision shall be made by the majority 
opinion , and in case of a tie , the chairperson of  such a  meeting may cast e a 
deciding vote.

www. lawcommission.gov.np  
10 
 (6) The decision of the Council shall be attested  by the chairperson 
and the registrar.  
(7) The meeting allowance and other facility  for the members of the 
Council  on attending the Council meeting shall be as prescribed.   
(8) The Council may determine other procedures on the meeting on its 
own.  
10. Functions, duties and power of the chairperson  : In addit ion to the matters 
mentioned elsewhere in this Act, the functions, duties and power of the 
Chairperson shall be as follows , namely: -   
(a) To determine agendas  with pri ority to be considered  in the Council 
meeting ;   
(b) To monitor  and e valuate, or cause to be mon itored and evaluate d, the 
programs run by the Council, and provide necessary direction related 
to such matters,   
(c) To operate or cause to be operate d, the work s of the Council in a n 
orderly,  systematic and effective manner;  
(d) To conduct such other necessary wo rk for the  attainment for the 
objectives o f the Council.    
11. Function to be performed  by Vice -Chairperson:  In the absence of the 
Chairperson, t he functions  of the Chairperson shall be performed by the 
Vice-Chairperson.

www. lawcommission.gov.np  
11 
 Chapter - 3 
Provisions on Registratio n of Name  
12. Prohibition to practice animal health and livestock  service profession  
without regist ering  name:  (1) No one shall be allowed  to practice the animal 
health and livestock service profession without registration of name  under 
this Act . 
Provided that  in the case of a veterinarian registered with the Nepal 
Veterinary Council under the prevailing  law, registration of the name under 
this Act shall not be required.  
(2) Notwithstanding anything contained  in sub -section (1), nothing 
shall prevent a person w ho has made application  for registration  of his name  
in accordance with  sub-section (1) of section 13  to practice  animal health 
and livestock service profession  until the final decision on registration is 
made.  
13. Application to be made for  registration of name : (1) An animal health and 
livestock  service professional  who has obtained the qualification from a 
recognized university, educational institution, academic  council or 
educational academy  specified in the schedule shall be required to  make  an 
applicati on as may be prescribed  for registration of their name in a 
registration book.  
(2) A person who, at the time of the entry into force of this Act,  
practices  the animal health and livestock  service profession with 
qualifications specified in the  schedule , shall be required to make an

www. lawcommission.gov.np  
12 
 application for registration of his /her name in accordance with subsection (1) 
one year after the entry into force of the Act .  
(3) Any animal health and livestock  service professional who makes 
an application pursuant to sub-section (1) or (2) for registration of his/her 
name shall be required to attach  the qualification certificates and fees as may 
be prescribed  to the application.  
(4) Notwithstanding anything contained  in sub–section s (1) or (3 ), in 
the event where  the provin cial law separately stipulates the procedure for 
registration , required documents and  fee to be paid, suc h law shall be 
applied thereof .  
14. Examination of application : The appropriate office  as may be prescribe d by 
the provincial law shall examine  the applic ation made pursuant to section 
13 whether   certificates as well as awards are  recognized and the application 
meets requirement s and make a decisio n to register  or not  the name of 
applicant in the register  book .  
(2) Where the  appropriate office  of the prov incial  government makes 
the decision on the  regist ration of  the applicant ’s name  in the register  book 
pursuant to sub -section (1) , it shall be done so and a certificate of 
registration in the prescribed form shall  be given to the applicant.  
(3)  Where it is decide d not to register the  applicant ’s name  pursuant 
to sub -section (1) the  appropriate office as may be prescribed by provincial 
law shall inform the applicant.  
15. Remov al of name  and re -registration:   The appropriate office as may be 
prescribed by the provincial law may issue an order to remove the name

www. lawcommission.gov.np  
13 
 registerd as the animal health and livestock service professional from the 
register book in any of the following circumstances: -  
(a) One w ho has been convicted  by a court related to  corruption, rape, 
human trafficking and transportation, drug trafficking and 
transportation , money laundering, passport fraud,  crime related to 
abduction or criminal offence  involving moral turpitude ;  
(b) Where Council decide s by a two -thirds majority  that s/he has failed to  
observe  the code of conduct ;  
(c) One w ho has become insolvent in accordance with the prevailing law ;  
(d) One w ho has become unable to practice  as an animal health and 
livestock  service professional due to physical and mental illness.   
(2) An animal health and livestoc k service  professional , whose name 
has been removed from the register book in the circumstances referred  in 
sub-section  (1), may  with good reasons submit a request for re -registration 
of his /her name . If such request is deemed acceptable, the appropriate office 
as may be  prescribed by the provincial law shall cause to re-register  his/her 
name  and provide a certificate of registration thereto.  
16. Revoca tion of certificate  : If the name of an unqualified person was 
inadvertently entered in the register book an d after an investigation it is 
established, th e appropriate office as prescribed by the provincial law may 
cancel such registration and revoke the  certificate .  
17. Class of animal health and livestock service professional  : For the purpose of  
the registratio n of name as an  animal health and livestock service

www. lawcommission.gov.np  
14 
 professional pursuant to this Act, anyone having  the following qualifications 
shall be eligible to register  in the following classes, namely: -  
(a) For c lass “A ”: An animal health and livestock service profes sional 
who has obtained a masters  degree  or doctorate in the  concerned  
subject  from a recognized university or academic institut ion.   
(b) For c lass “B ”: An animal health and livestock service professional 
who has obtained a bachelor’s  degree or its equivalent  in a field 
related to animal health and livestock  service from a recognized 
university or academic institution  or who has ten years of "Class C" 
experience and meets continuing education requirements as 
determined by the Council . 
(c) For c lass “C” : An animal health and livestock service professional 
who has obtained high school education or its equivalent in the field 
related to animal health and livestock  service from a recognized 
university or academic institution  or who has five years of "Class D" 
experienc e and meets continuing education requirements as 
determined by the Council.  
(d) For c lass “D” : An animal health and livestock service professional 
who has obtained school  level certificate or its equivalent in the field 
related to animal health and livestock  service  from a  recognized 
university or academic institution .  
18. To practice  animal health and livestock service profession : A person having 
the educational qualification and training referred to in section 17 may

www. lawcommission.gov.np  
15 
 practice  a profession related to animal healt h and livestock  service out of the 
profession as such may be prescribed.  
19. Examination to be taken  : (1) In order to maintain quality in the field of 
animal health and livestock service profession, the appropriate office may 
take examination as may be presc ribed for those who w ant to register their 
name as an animal health and livestock service professional.  
(2) If it is arranged  to take the examination  in accordance with sub-
section  (1), the name of the person who failed the exam cannot be entered in 
the register  book.  
20. Rural Animal Health Workers:  (1) Before the entry into force of this Act, 
rural animal health workers who received training from the Government of 
Nepal within a specified period and worked in the field of animal health and 
livestock  service  until they meet the qualifications defined in the schedule  
shall be caused to be registered in a separate register book as may be  
prescribed by the  provincial law .  
(2) The r ural animal health workers who registered  pursuant  to sub -
section (1) may practic e the animal health and livestock  service  profession  
as may be prescribed.   
(3) The appropriate office as may be prescribed by the provincial law 
shall  regulate whether  the rural animal health workers registered  under sub -
section (1)  perfom the prescribed  works or not.  
(4) If the rural animal health worker s who are  registered under this 
section continues to work in the field of animal health and livestock  service

www. lawcommission.gov.np  
16 
 for ten years, they shall be registered in the class  referred to  in clause (d) of  
section 17  if he passes the skill test .  
(5) Other provisions pertaining to registration, regulation and 
capacity -building of the rural animal health workers shall be as prescribed .  
21. To perform by Council  : (1) Notwithstanding anything contained elsewhere 
in this Chapter , the Council shall perform such functions  as prescribed  to 
perform  until the provincial law is enacted .  
(2) When the C ouncil performs the functions  in accordance with sub -
section (1), the period and fee under this  Chapter shall be as prescribed.   
Chapter - 4  
Recognition of educational degree and certificate  
22. Recognition of education al qualification:  The M inistry may,  on  
recommendation of the Council , provide  a recognition to  the qualification 
certificates or other degrees related to animal health a nd livestock  service .  
(2) Academic subjects and name of educational institut ions  
recog nized under sub -section (1) shall be published in the Nepal Gazette.  
(3) Other provisions pertaining to granting  recognition to  educational 
qualification s shall be as prescribed.   
23.  Standard s to be prescribed  : (1) The Council may prescribe the standards 
that educational institution related to animal health and  livestock service 
shall  comply with the implementation of such educational programs.

www. lawcommission.gov.np  
17 
 (2) The educational instit utions related to animal health and livestock  
service  operating at time of  the entry into force of this Act shall be required 
to fulfill the standards specified in sub -section (1) within six months .  
(3) Notwithstanding anything contained  in this Chapter , the curricula, 
admission requirements and examination systems of the educational 
institutions providing the education and awarding certificates necessary for 
registration with the Nepal Veterinary Council shall be  in accordance with 
the prevailing law.  
(4) If the standards are not met within the time as specified in  sub-
section (2) or if they are found  to have been violated, the Council may 
recommend that the recognition of such educational institution be revoked.  
24.  Assessment  to be made : (1) The Council may make assessment  of the 
curricul a and requirements  determined for the admission of such educational 
institutions which is recognized pursuant to section 22 .  
(2) For the purpose of sub -section (1), the Council may require   
documents and details from such  educational institution  if necessary.   
(3) It shall be the duty of the concerned institution  to provide the 
documents and details as requested by the Council  pursuant to sub-section 
(2).  
25. Recognition  to be cancelled : (1)  If, based on the documents and i nformation 
received in accordance with section  24, the Council finds that the curricul a, 
admission requirements, teaching -learning method, examination  system  of 
the relevant educational institution  recognized by the Council  are

www. lawcommission.gov.np  
18 
 inappropriate and unsatisfa ctory , then the Council shall be required to 
submit a report with its opinion to the Ministry .  
(2) After receiving the report from the Council in accordance with 
sub-section ( 1), the Ministry shall , if necessary, request additi onal 
information or explanat ion from the relevant educational institution. A nd  it 
shall be duty of the relevant educational institution to submit additional data 
or explanations within the stipulated time at the request of the Council.  
(3) While h aving examined the report received b y the Council 
purauant to  sub-section ( 1) or the information or explanation  received 
pursuant to sub -section  (2), the Ministry shall cause to conduct  a further 
inquiry,  if necessary , through a committee or a working group of experts.   
(4) Based on the rep ort received pursuant to  sub-section (1) and 
information  and explanation  received pursuant to sub-section (2), the 
Ministry may cancel qualification  certificates and other diplomas  awarded 
after a certain period of time or the recognition  granted pursuant to section 
22. The notice of such cancellation of recognition shall be published in the 
Nepal Gazette.   
26. Invigilation  of Examination : (1) The Council may cause invigilat ion of  the 
examination to be conducted by the relevant educational institution  
recognize d under section 22  to award  qualification certificates or other 
degrees.  
(2) The Council may appoint invigilators  and send them  to invigilate  
the examination s pursuant to  sub-section (1) , as required.

www. lawcommission.gov.np  
19 
 (3) The invigilator  appointed pursuant to sub-section  (2) shall be 
required  to provide the Council with a report on  invigilation  of the 
examinations, specifying the matters as prescribed.  
(4) The invigilator appointed in accordance with sub-section (2) shall 
in no way interfere with the examination.  
Chapter  - 5  
Provision relating to Employees  
27. Registrar:  The Ministry shall appoint a n animal health and livestock service 
professional who  has obtained a bachelor's degree from a  recognized 
university  and is registered  with the Council  at least with class “B” as the 
registrar of the Council.  
(2) The terms, conditions and facilities of the registrar shall be as 
prescribed.   
(3) In the absence of the registrar or until a registrar is appointed 
under sub –section (1), the Ministry may designate  an official of the 
Government of Nepal or the Council who is qualified to be the registrar as 
the registrar.  
28. Power, duties and functions of the Registrar : In addition to the power, duties 
and functions stipulated  elsewhere in this Act, the power, duties and function 
of the Regi strar shall be as follows :- 
(a) To prepare the a genda to be submitted  for consideration in the 
Council  meeting  in consultation with the Chairperson ;

www. lawcommission.gov.np  
20 
 (b) To implement or cause to be implemented the decision s of the 
Council ;  
(c) To perform suc h other functions as may be prescribed.   
29.  Employees of the Council : (1) The organizational structure of the Council 
shall be  approved by the Ministry  based on the  Council’s  workload, 
resources,  means and  financial conditions.   
(2) The approval of the Government of Nepal, the Ministry of Finance 
shall  be obtained before approv ing the organizational structure pursuant to 
sub-section (1)  
(3) The C ouncil may appoint employees to the  positions as approved 
in the organizational structure pursuant to  sub-section (1).   
(4) The  employee s appointed pursuant to   sub-section ( 3) shall  remain 
under the direct control and supervision of the Registrar.  
Chapter - 6  
Fund of Council   
30.  Fund of the Council : (1) A separate fund  shall be created for the Council.  
(2) The following  sums of mo ney sh all be deposited in the fund under 
sub-section (1): -  
(a) Sums  received from the Government of Nepal , the Provincial 
Government or  Local Level;

www. lawcommission.gov.np  
21 
 (b) Sums received by the way of assistance from domestic 
organizations ;  
(c) Sums received as assistance from foreign gover nments or 
international organizations ; 
(d) Other amounts earned by the Council.   
(3) Before receiving the sums  pursuant to  clause (c) of sub -section (2),  
approval of the Government of Nepal, the Ministry of Finance shall be 
required to obtain.  
(4) The sums o f money  of the fu nd created pursuant to sub-section (1) 
shall be deposited in  a bank account opened in a commercial bank 
designated by the Council .  
(5) All expenses incurred on behalf of the Council shall be borne by 
the fund pursunat to sub -section (1).  
(6) The operation of the fund pursuant to  sub-section (1) shall be as 
prescribed.   
31. Accounting and auditing : (1) The accounts of income and expenditure of the 
Council shall be kept in format s adopted by the Government of Nepal.   
(2) The internal audit of t he Council’s  income and expenditure shall 
be carried out  by an auditor appointed by the Council from among st the 
registered auditors and the final audit  by an auditor designated  by the 
Auditor General.

www. lawcommission.gov.np  
22 
 (3) The Government of Nepal may at any time inspect  or cause to be 
inspected documents relating to the accounts of the funds of the Council , if 
wishes to do so.  
Chapter - 7  
Offence  and P enalty   
32. To be deemed offence : If any person  who practices  animal health and 
livestock service  profession  without having t he name registered under  
Section 12 shall be deemed  to have committed an offence  under this Act.   
33. Penalty:   (1) The  person who commits an offence  under  section 32 shall be 
punished with a fine up to  fifty thousand rupees or imprisonment for a term 
up to si x months or both, depending on the degree of the offence.   
(2) Except as provided  in sub -section (1), if any person does anything 
contrary to this Act or the rules made hereunder, such person shall be fined  
with up to thirty thousand rupees.   
Chapter - 8  
Miscellaneous   
34.  Investigation and filling of case: An investigation of a case punishable 
under section 33 shall be carried out  by an officer of the C ouncil appointed 
by it and after the completion of such investigation, the case shall  be filed 
with a corre sponding district court on taking opinion of the government 
attorney.

www. lawcommission.gov.np  
23 
 35. The Government of Nepal shall be plaintiff : The Government of Nepal shall 
be a plaintiff in the case filed under this Act.   
36. Dissolution of the Council:   (1) If the Council has not exer cised the powers 
conferred to it  by this Act and the Regulations  made hereunder  or has abused 
its powers, exercised more powers than it has been conferred  to or neglected 
to perform its duties under the Act and the Regulations made hereunder, the 
Governme nt of Nepal may dissolve the Council.  
Provided that prior to dissolution of the Council,  it shall be provided 
with an opportunity to improv e or correct  its work, or activities.   
(2) After  the dissolution of the Council pursuant to sub -section (1), the 
Government of Nepal shall take over the funds and oth er assets of the 
Council under its own c ontrol until a new council is formed, and shall 
perfom  all the functions  of the  Council in accordance with this Act and the 
Regulations  made hereunder  or form a committ ee to perfom those  functions.  
(3) The Government  of Nepal shall form another C ouncil pursuant to 
sub-section (1) of section 5 w ithin six month s after the dissolution of the 
Council pursuant to  sub-section (1) .  
(4) After the formation of another C ouncil pursuant to  sub-section (3), 
the funds and assets  taken  over by the Government of Nepal pursuant to sub -
section (2) shall be transferred to that C ouncil.   
37.  Committee:  (1) The Council may form various thematic  committees to 
impleme nt the decisions of the Cou ncil as may be prescribed.

www. lawcommission.gov.np  
24 
 (2) The work, duties and rights of the thematic  committee formed  
pursuant to  sub-section (1) shall be as prescribed.   
38.  Delegation of powers:  The Council may delegate any or all of its powers 
conferred on  it under this Act to th e Chairperson , Vice -Chairperson  or 
members , if necessary.  
39. Applicability of this  Act: The matters referred to in  this Act or any rules 
made hereunder shall be ruled by this  Act, while other matters be s ubject to 
the prevailing law of Nepal.  
40.  To liaison  with the Government of Nepal  : The Council shall liaise with the 
Government of Nepal through the Ministry .  
41.  To evaluate  implementation of Act: Within one year after the entry into 
force of this Act, and then within one year in every five years, the Ministry  
shall evaluate  the implementation of th is Act  and present a report to the 
respective committees of both Houses  of the Federal Parliament.  
42.  Power to make  rules : The G overnment of Nepal shall make  necessary rules 
in order to implement this Act.   
43.  Power to make bye-laws:  (1) T he Council shall make necessary bye-laws on 
matters related to the recruitment of employees, terms and conditions of 
service and facilities as well as  the operation of the C ouncil.   
(2) The bye-laws made pursuant to  sub-section (1) shall  come into 
force after being approved by the Ministry.

www. lawcommission.gov.np  
25 
 (3) Prior to  granting the approval  of the Ministry pursuant to sub -
section (2 ), the consent of the  Ministry of Finance in matters of financial 
liability  shall be required to obtain.  
44.  Power to frame g uidelines and procedures : Under the authority of this Act 
and the rules made under this Act, the Council shall  make necessary 
guidelines and procedures with the approval of the Ministry.   
45.  Changes in schedule : The Government of Nepal may make changes in th e 
schedule if necessary by publishing a notice in the Nepal  Gazette .

 Schedule  
(Related to Section 13)  
Qualification of animal health and livestock service professional s  
(a)  Having g raduated  S.E.E. or equivalent thereof and having received one year 
stock supervisor training ;  
(b) Having graduated technical S.E.E. or equivalent thereof in the subject of 
animal health and animal husbandry ;  
(c) Having graduated S.E.E. or equivalent thereof and graduated J.T.A. course ( 
animal science) ;   
(d) Having gradua ted S.E.E. or equivalent thereof and graduated  the skill test of 
Level - 2 in the subject of Animal Science from the Council of technical 
education and vocational training ;  
(e) Having graduated  proficiency c ertificate level in the subject of Animal 
Scienc e or graduated class twelve in the subject related to animal health and 
livestock  service or graduated the technical proficiency certificate level, 
diploma (3 years) course, or ;  
(f) Having graduated b achelor ’s degree  or equivalent thereof  in the subject o f 
animal science or fisheries  science or graduated master’s  degree  or doctorate 
in related subject.
